channel.title: The Aquilar Logs

item.title: Moska's Note
item.description: A note, written by Master Moska, left with Ava's luggage aboard the The Zalos

item.title: Chapter 2
item.description:
The expedition will leave in a week, in which time Ava should start showing the new recruits around and starting their basic training. It seems Clemence is also in need of some clothes since his are in tatters and he doesn't have any spare with him.
Selene notices that the size of the Guild is way bigger than the amount of people walking around would need. Clemence starts filling in his name and information. She sees his full name is "Clemence Dukus" from the far colonies, and his previous occupation was miner.
Ava starts compiling a list of things needed for the journey. Explorers' handbook, training equipment, specialty lists. It would probably be best to ask Master Orlof, responsible for the archives, or Master Armatalla, head of the administrative branch. She takes Clemence and Selene to the administrative branch to introduce them to Master Armatalla as well. She allows me to make a list of the supplies we need, and she hands the rookies small pouches with advance pay for their work.
After that Ava takes them to Master Orlof, a very old man, with small round glasses perched on his nose. He gives the rookies each a book called "The Explorer's Guide to Exploring".
There is one more master, Master Roudaver, head of engineering, but he is not very social and would not appreciate random introductions.
Outside the Autumn Palace, Veronica and Dorian meet again. Veronica goes on about squeezing(?), and apparently she's homeless. Dorian mentions he is going to The Inbetween and invites her to come. They discuss the assignment Veronica got from his aunt. They realise they have very different views on life and knowledge.
They take the shortest route towards Dorian's office, and he gets the feeling they were being shadowed by several figures who are closing in on them. They dash into an alley but the figures dash after them and they start to gain fast. Veronica takes out a welding torch and burns the hinges off a door to a dingy hovel. They head up the stairs to another exit. Dorian tries to push a wardrobe in the way, but it doesn't budge. They are making good ground and manage to outrun the people following them as they burst out into a street with Greycap presence. To experience the feeling for travel, Veronica decides they should visit Aluminum Bay and Dorian follows.
Since they have a week before the journey, Ava takes Selene and Clemence to The Outpost to get them some drinks. They talk to the proprietor, Engine, who warns the rookies not to get killed. He says handling artefacts can be dangerous and points to a man with a half-molten face who had come into contact with the Blight. Ava tells them of her previous expedition and her encounters with the Blight. How it usually shows up as a red glow on flora. They talk to some of the other adventurers in the bar and make introductions. Clemence seems to immediately have lost the money he got before because his clothes are filled with holes, so they buy him some cheap workers clothes.
Ava, Selene, and Clemence made their way to the edge of Aluminum Bay, to see the Greatship they will be taking on their expedition. The outside is mostly red with with thick golden chains welded on, the red paint going into blue at the back of the ship in a gradient to symbolise a sunset. As Ava is giving a lecture about the workings of the Greatship, Dorian and Veronica scoot up and start listening and asking questions. Dorian mentions he is an archeologist and is going on a pilgrimage. Ava says she can ask Master Moska if they are in need of an archeologist and an artist. They seem to be convinced they are also leaving in a week so we decide to inquire at the Navigators Guild.
The group gets approached by a woman in uniform, Captain Atsæmæz, (she is the second captain not the captain albay) who would be on the Greatship, and thanks Ava for the work she's done on the hull of the ship. The whole group introduces themselves and the Captain says she looks forward to speaking with us more on the journey.
They discuss the Golgayad family, and Dorian mentions he knows of and admires Ava's grandfather Dacaro Aquilar. Selene mentions that she would like to learn more about her own family, and Dorian knows that her family is associated with the disappearance of a Greatship, the Hamurabi. The first officer of the Hamurabi expedition was called Dara, who was found adrift in an escape pod after the ship was lost. Dorian promised to do research on her family while she is training for the next week.
At the Navigators Guild we find a list with the manifest for the journey, which does list Dorian Golgayad and Veronica Buttons.
During the week, Veronica collects some (fine) tools from her patron for her work. Dorian looks for books on the Dara name and family. He also attends the last mass before leaving to appease his family. Ava spends the week training Selene and Clemence in their physicality, to up their endurance for the expedition, The Zalos.
At the setting-off day of the voyage, The Zalos is moored at The Maw. All are checked at the entrance and given a key to a cabin. Dorian is in a small room like this as well. Veronica has a very posh room with an entertainment system, her luggage already brought in, and a note welcoming her, and an itinerary attached to it.

item.title: Dacaro Aquilar
item.description: Ava Aquilar's grandfather. A fairly famous explorer, known for charting and cartographing the Asrabourne Runnel, a dead end in the Slipstream.

item.title: Master Roudaver
item.description: Head of Engineering. Not very sociable. Situated in Aluminum Bay.

item.title: Master Orlof
item.description: Head of the archives at the Explorers Guild. A very old man, with small round glasses perched on his nose. He is quite deaf.

item.title: Master Moska
item.description: Leader of the Explorers Guild, formerly a part of the Navigators Guild.

item.title: Master Armatalla
item.description: Head of the administrative branch

item.title: Layla
item.description: Receptionist at the Explorers Guild

item.title: Julia Golgayad Mirmira
item.description: Dorian's aunt. Eccentric older woman who keeps offering drugs.

item.title: Engine
item.description: Proprietor of The Outpost

item.title: Garuda
item.description:
For the Explorers, no companion is as vital as their Bird. Without it, every delve becomes a far riskier and more uncertain venture. Birds have transformed the art of exploring ruins, so much so that few can even recall a time before these strange creatures became the steadfast guardians of Explorers braving the Great Dark. First encountered in a sealed pod orbiting the dead portal of Arakvarat in the year 112, the species commonly known as Garuda, or in everyday talk simply the Birds, has had a major impact on the fate of the human Diaspora. These creatures that were strangely similar to the flying animals of old Ardha, seemed to have slept for eons, awaiting discovery. But why? After early missteps, where scientists mistakenly believed the Garuda to be simple animals, researchers learned that the Birds had powers that defied explanation. Later research proved a connection to The Builders and it is indeed hypothesised that the Garuda were left behind by the Builders as guardians of their legacy. During later trials, it was discovered that the Birds proved uniquely resilient to the Blight and could even repel it for short intervals. With these discoveries, the Navigators Guild and other factions across the Diaspora stopped seeing the Garuda as mere curiosities. Instead, they began to view them as partners, vital to humanity's survival and progress in the vast unknown of the Great Dark. Expeditions were soon routinely assisted by Garuda, and with their powers, hitherto undiscovered routes and ruins were uncovered.Over time, the Garuda have become an integral part of Diaspora culture. Their images decorate walls and temples, and having one at the head of an expedition is considered a blessing, a sign of good luck. Yet, despite their usefulness, the Birds remain a mystery. Why were they sealed away for so long? What are they truly meant for? And most pressing of all - could they be the key to stopping the blight that threatens humanity's future?Garuda birds are not real animals nor native to Ship City. They are in fact bioengineered artifacts encountered during the exploration of Charted Sphere. Even though there are thousands of Birds in the city today they all originate from different ruin sites. Bird handlers call a group of Birds found in the same ruin a batch, often with the suffix of the actual ruin name. The very first batch was the Arakvarat one. Examples of later ones are Red (Red Garden), Xu (Great Vault of Xu) and Sirra (Caves of Sirra). Birds from the same batch can often (but not always) be identified by common traits such as feather structure, wing span, shape, colour, and patterns.
The first Garuda to awaken from the Arakvarat batch became one of the most legendary Birds in Ship City’s history. Known as Arak, it was a majestic and powerful creature, resembling a falcon in its full splendor. However, when scientists from the Navigators Guild attempted to anesthetize it for a vivisection, disaster struck. Arak awoke with a piercing shriek and unleashed a devastating energy wave, instantly killing a dozen navigators. From that day, the people of the Diaspora learned that the only way to collaborate with the Birds was through respect. The Arakvarat Falcon went on to join several notable expeditions and was eventually gifted to Master Moska upon the founding of the Explorers Guild. Arak still remains at her side, both feared and revered.
Birds are a common sight across Ship City, often perched on the shoulders of dignitaries or Explorers, or even flying freely in the Chasm. However there is one place more associated with the Garuda than anywhere else and that is the Bird Market located in the Chasm. Here, bird traders, trainers, speculants, and others mingle around scores of small stalls perched on the steep floor of the surrounding grotto. If you have an inquiry regarding a Bird, this should likely be your first stop.
The three primary factions using the Birds are the Navigators Guild, the Coriolites, and the Explorers Guild. Each of these utilise Bird scouts that scour Ship City for the most precious Garuda specimen to give them an extra edge. As the Birds are valued so highly, they are heavily regulated by Guild law, and indeed destroying a Garuda is punishable by the strictest sentence possible: a lifetime of exile to the Habanatum system. Still, a thriving black market surrounds the trade of Birds and there are even reports of Garuda hunters tracking, capturing, and sometimes killing Birds that roam free in the lower parts of the city.
The Birds are not only essential companions for Explorers, they have also become a fashion symbol for the extremely rich. Being seen with a golden long-tailed Garuda from the Sirra batch, or the purple coat of the very rare Xu batch, is perhaps the ultimate status symbol among the upper strata of Ship City society. The Coriolites in particular are famous for their penchant for exotic Garuda, the more rare and impractical the specimen, the better. This use of the Birds as mere status symbols is seen as vulgar by Explorers and Navigators alike, who value the Garuda for their special powers and not their hide. Still, the practice continues.
Lesser known is the fact that there are free Birds roaming the lower parts of Ship City. These avoid people as much as possible, and especially the Garuda Hunters sent out by the Black Toad to capture valuable specimens. Where they come from is not known, but it is presumed that they are Birds that have been traded on the black market and somehow escaped their former masters. To make the phenomena even more strange; the free Birds seem to thrive together, in a swarm. This goes against all that is known about the Garuda. Some speculate that the free Birds have developed some kind of distributed mass intelligence, but no one knows for sure.

item.title: Chapter 3
item.description:
The greatship is supposed to leave at 11:00. Dorian disembarks for a little bit to see if any of his family is there to see him off, but he doesn't see anyone there.
Selene is unpacking her things and finds some things she didn't pack; a weapon which she's only supposed to use under supervision, and a cryptic note.
Veronica also goes to see if she notices anyone familiar seeing her off. She sees the proprietor of Aram's Cantine, as well as his grandmother. She also sees Moe, the proprietor of the small theatre. She makes a quick drawing of them and folds it into an airplane and throws it at them, but misses. She then approaches Dorian and asks if his bird, Kestrel, could deliver the note.
When Ava unpacks her luggage, she finds a note as well as 200 rukh and a gun.
Ava moves to meet with Selene and Clemence to show them around, and finds that they were also given guns. When they look for Clemence, he isn't in his room, so they quickly go search him to make sure he's on the ship. This ship is way more luxurious than the ones Ava had seen before, the travel probably houses a few big names. They eventually find Clemence at the bar, he's drinking, thinks the drinks are free, they are not. They let him finish his drink and then go to the lounge to watch the ship departure.
Veronica and Dorian also move back to their rooms, where Veronica finds a copy of her contract and the supplies she requested, and Dorian also finds a note from his mother.
Dorian joins the others at the viewing deck, and can finally see his mother in the crowd. A lot of people are gathered there, waving at the greatship, mostly younger ones. The adults seem to keep their composure more, and seem to be mostly Coriolites. Dorian asks a woman in a silver masks why there are so many Coriolites, she says this expedition was entirely funded by five big Coriolites, which doesn't usually happen. She introduces herself as Ami Alamasi.
After the ship's departure, a few of the Coriolites aboard take of their masks as if a ritual has just finished. Veronica finds Dorian to give him a drawing of Kestrel, who immediately launches into a lecture on Garuda. Misunderstandings were had about opening up and killing Kestrel. The crew overhears the conversation and they join up again.
Dorian explains that officially he is on a spiritual journey to find faith. He doesn't explain the unofficial reason. After a little further introduction Dorian asks Ava for a bit of a tour of the ship. Even though this greatship is a lot more fancily decorated, the layout seems to be about the same as the other greatships Ava has been on, it even seems a little smaller. They move to the back of the ship where the carpet disappears, and they find the mooring points, where Echo's Light seems to be moored. It's weird that it's here since none of them knew about it. There also only seem to be 6 mooring points here, of which 5 are occupied; Echo's Light, 2 silver gleaming shuttles (very posh), one rickety ship with chipped off paint, and one with the same colour pattern as the Zalos. Usually there are more than 10.A young man asks what they are doing in the mooring bay, they ask him why the Echo's Light. He brings an older man over to us who leaves through a log and tells us it was boarded on orders of Moska of the Explorers' Guild.
Dorian asks the group who is going to the lecture on Moubarra the following day. Most of them seem to be going.
They continue on the tour, mostly past cabins and workshops. Also an infirmary, and the other lounge. They do eventually see a staircase that leads up to the bridge, but only personnel is permitted. Dorian visits the library to try and do some research on the Dara family, but finds mostly religious texts. Ava, Selene, and Clemence start on their physical training, and Veronica goes to her room to tinker on some art.
At 18:00 a gong goes off to indicate dinner is served. Everyone moves to the Dining Hull. Veronica notices Julia's son, who she sits with, Dorian spots representatives of practically all powerful Coriolite families, as well as the current heads of the Nazar family, who he thinks the silver shuttles in the mooring bay belong to. He ends up sitting at a table with some other Coriolites, but doesn't talk to them. The others go sit together.
Around 19:00, a woman, the Captain Albay; Demet Ashur, in red and white, and the captain from before, Captain Atsæmæz in white and blue introduce themselves and open a concert in honour of the Traveler. An early start to the evening's mass. A bowl goes around collecting small pieces of knotted rope as offering, getting collected at the stage and lit into a small bonfire.

item.title: Chapter 1
item.description:
2025-11-24Dorian entered his father's office, and was told he was shirking his duties and got an ultimatum. Get secluded for a year, or go on a pilgrimage to find the ultimate faith.
Veronica had a conversation with Dorian's aunt Julia Golgayad Mirmira, who asked her to make a sculpture based on the feeling or essence of the slipstream. Inspired by a journey on a Greatship.
Ava goes to do research on the Ordana Station. It's the northern station from Ship City, also called the Northern Arm, the first system there is called Gamaru. She digs into the archives to find information about her grandfather going to the system. He was one of the explorers that documented the Asrabourne Runnel, a slipstream dead end. This was very dangerous because there was a possibility of getting stuck at the end and having to travel back for a year. Gamaru and Gamaru B. A bi-solar system, with two stars.
The front door swings open and a very haphazard looking young man with a tear in his tunic and dirt on his face storms in. He asks if this is Vermillion House and thanks the gods he's arrived at the right place after 4 days of searching. He says he got a letter informing him he has to meet with Moska, but he seems to have lost the letter. Ava realised this must be the last member of her crew, and takes him up to Moska's office. His name is Clemence, and she informs Moska he's arrived.

item.title: Chapter 0
item.description:
2025-11-11After welding up a great ship, docked in the Aluminum Bay, Ava makes her way to the cantina. There, a messenger tells her she's expected at the Vermillion House. She finishes her meal, and goes home for a quick shower before reporting to the guild.
Made her way to The Chasm, to the guild. Greeted by an older woman, Layla, who tells her the master is expecting her. Master Moska invites her in the office, a huge map on the wall portraying the know star system.
She asks about Ava's work, and tells her she's not the only one having trouble finding exploring work. Moska has a proposition for her to be part of a new crew, funded by the Explorers Guild. On the surface Ava would be training some people that were new to the guild, taking on the role of Senior Explorer, but really she would be gathering intel. Moska says the rookie has just arrived and Ava should pick her up from the harbour and bring her to the Vermillion House. I ask for a description to find her and I get a note with a picture and the name Selene Dara.
It doesn't take long for Ava to find Selene in Hull Town. She glares at the vendor harassing Selene, and ask if she's the person Ava is looking for. She confirms and tells me she's supposed to meet with Master Moska, so Ava lead her back to the guild and introduce myself.
They arrive at the guild, where Selene registers her name with Layla. As she mentions her last name, Layla shows almost a bit of contempt, a little scoff. Ava leads Selene upstairs to Moska's office, where Ava is asked to give them a moment alone.
Ava stood next to the door agains the wall, and managed to overhear some things about Barrabas, exile, and Hamurabi, but nothing concrete. When Selene exits, she's asked to enter the office, where Moska informed her that in a week they are to work with the Navigators Guild customs, and board the Zelos, which will go on its way to Gamaru. The Explorers Guild had lost contact with an explorer group there, and they are meant to find them under the guise of training the rookies. They are supposed to report to Ordana Station, an explorers guild branch on Gamaru. Master Moska says another person is supposed to join the crew, but she doesn't know when they will arrive yet.

item.title: Vermillion House
item.description: Old hospital that was abandoned and then picked up by the Explorers Guild as their guild house.A 3-story stone building that had been haphazardly restored. A small inner courtyard in front, and two wings stretching out to either side.

item.title: Ava Aquilar
item.description:
InfoUnder the Sunless Sky of the Far Colonies (22) Talent: Endurace +1 Associated Faction: Mining Combine Contact: Cantina owner Rada Johuna Quirk: Eye-catching tattoo (64)Roughneck Key Attribute: Strength Key Talents: Endurance, Force, Jury-Rig, Scan Operator
Equipment: Exo suit, welding torch, fine tools (5)Number of Columns: 2 Largest Column: standard Border: off InfoUnder the Sunless Sky of the Far Colonies (22) Talent: Endurace +1 Associated Faction: Mining Combine
Contact: Cantina owner Rada Johuna Quirk: Eye-catching tattoo (64)Roughneck Key Attribute: Strength Key Talents: Endurance, Force, Jury-Rig, Scan Operator Equipment: Exo suit, welding torch, fine tools (5)--- column-break ---
--- end-multi-columnWreck Diver You had a knack for spotting entry points and deciphering blueprints just by looking at an old wreck. To you, every wreck was an intriguing spatial puzzle. Squeezing through tight spaces without damaging your exo-suit, you were always the first to find and secure treasures for your crewmates. With tools to cut, pry, and bend hull plates – or set precise charges to separate entire sections – you proved your skill in both reading schematics and the practical art of dismantling wrecks. Free Talent: Exo-Specialist
Quite some time ago, Ava's grandfather, Dacaro Aquilar, was a well renowned explorer and map maker. He led many an expedition and charted large swaths of the Charted Sphere, until one day he disappeared, his crew claiming he was with them one moment and gone the next. Ava remembers Dacaro telling her stories of his adventures and she was enraptured by the tales of exploration and the ancient ruins they found along the way, and from the exact moment of his disappearance, she started dreaming of a maze-like structure.
When Dacaro disappeared, his son and Ava's father, Dinan Aquilar lost himself in alcohol and drugs in his sorrow, and he and his family were sent to the Far Colonies to work off the debts he'd accumulated. When Ava was old enough to work, she put her affinity for mapping tunnels to good use in the mines. She worked hard and eventually found her way back to Ship City, where she begged Master Moska to let her explore the Lost Horizon like her grandfather had done. Ava mostly worked on salvage in the mean time, bringing in anything valuable from wrecked ships, studying blueprints and knowing the exact routes to take for the crew to go in and out with the least resistance. The maze in her dreams never stopped appearing, and Ava spent many nights wandering the halls and tunnels of this place she'd never been. She sketched out maps of the routes she'd taken, and eventually had these tattoo'd onto and around her fore-arms and on her back. Thin lines, seeming like nothing but an abstract jumble to most people who looked at them, but to her a maze she had been dreaming of so long, it had become part of her.Crew Cards4 resultsSort0Filter3PropertiesNewFjFjFjFjFj
